# criteria.coverage { #pyLHD.criteria.coverage }

`criteria.coverage(arr)`

Compute the coverage measure for a design

## Parameters

| Name   | Type          | Description                                                                                        | Default    |
|--------|---------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------|
| `arr`  | numpy.ndarray | A design matrix. If design matrix is not within [0,1], the origianl design will be scaled to [0,1] | _required_ |

## Raises

| Type       | Description                                            |
|------------|--------------------------------------------------------|
| ValueError | Whenever number of rows is less than number of columns |

## Returns

| Type   | Description      |
|--------|------------------|
| float  | Coverage measure |

## Examples



```{python}
import pyLHD
random_lhd = pyLHD.random_lhd(n_rows=5,n_columns=5)
pyLHD.coverage(random_lhd)
```
